channel.title: Need Help with array and for statement
channel.description: So I found my problem in my herblore skill, I'm just trying to make all the interfaces work for everything, so you can make 10 of everything like runescape and stuff. But my error points here: [code=java] for(int i : OTHER_SHIT){ if(!hasItems(i, currentItem)){ if(player.getUsername().equals("sageofmali")) player.sm("Messes up here !!. Current item: "+currentItem+" Other: "+i+" ID: "+id+" AMOUNT: "+amount+""); player.getHerblore().reset(); return; } }[/code] What I'm trying to do is check if the inventory contains one of the items in the OTHER_SHIT array I have and has the currentItem as well. Here's the array: [code=java] public static int OTHER_SHIT[] = {221, 235, 225, 592, 1939, 223, 1581, 1975, 239, 231, 221, 235, 231, 2970, 10111, 225, 241, 223, 239, 245, 247};[/code] And here's the hasItem method: [code=java] private boolean hasItems(int itemOne, int itemTwo) { return (player.getInventory().contains(itemOne) && player.getInventory().contains(itemTwo)); }[/code] What I think is going on is that it's going through every item in the array and if you don't have all of the items in the array, it stops you from making the item. How could I fix this, because I use the OTHER_SHIT array for only this part and those items are in this: [code=java] public static final int[][][] HERBLORE_INFO = new int[][][] { { { VIAL, 249, 0 }, { 91 }, { 1 }, { 321 } }, { { VIAL, 251, 1 }, { 93 }, { 5 }, { 504 } }, { { VIAL, 253, 2 }, { 95 }, { 12 }, { 612 } }, { { VIAL, 255, 3 }, { 97 }, { 22 }, { 785 } }, { { VIAL, 257, 4 }, { 99 }, { 30 }, { 990 } }, { { VIAL, 259, 5 }, { 101 }, { 45 }, { 1075 } }, { { VIAL, 261, 6 }, { 103 }, { 50 }, { 1875 } }, { { VIAL, 263, 7 }, { 105 }, { 55 }, { 2250 } }, { { VIAL, 3000, 8 }, { 3004 }, { 63 }, { 3900 } }, { { VIAL, 265, 9 }, { 107 }, { 66 }, { 4500 } }, { { VIAL, 267, 10 }, { 109 }, { 72 }, { 5000 } }, { { VIAL, 269, 11 }, { 111 }, { 78 }, { 7000 } }, { { 221, 91, 12 }, { 2428 }, { 1 }, { 250 } }, { { 235, 93, 13 }, { 2446 }, { 5 }, { 375 } }, { { 225, 95, 14 }, { 113 }, { 12 }, { 500 } }, { { 592, 95, 15 }, { 3408 }, { 15 }, { 500 } }, { { 1939, 91, 16 }, { 10142 }, { 19 }, { 300 } }, { { 223, 97, 17 }, { 2430 }, { 22 }, { 625 } }, { { 1581, 97, 18 }, { 1582 }, { 25 }, { 800 } }, { { 1975, 97, 19 }, { 3008 }, { 26 }, { 675 } }, { { 239, 99, 20 }, { 2432 }, { 30 }, { 750 } }, { { 231, 99, 21 }, { 2434 }, { 38 }, { 875 } }, { { 221, 101, 22 }, { 2436 }, { 45 }, { 2000 } }, { { 235, 101, 23 }, { 2448 }, { 48 }, { 2063 } }, { { 231, 103, 24 }, { 2438 }, { 50 }, { 2125 } }, { { 2970, 103, 25 }, { 3016 }, { 52 }, { 2175 } }, { { 10111, 103, 26 }, { 9998 }, { 53 }, { 2200 } }, { { 225, 105, 27 }, { 2440 }, { 55 }, { 2250 } }, { { 241, 105, 28 }, { 187 }, { 60 }, { 2375 } }, { { 223, 3004, 29 }, { 3024 }, { 63 }, { 2425 } }, { { 239, 107, 30 }, { 2442 }, { 66 }, { 2500 } }, { { 245, 109, 31 }, { 2444 }, { 72 }, { 2625 } }, { { 247, 111, 32 }, { 2450 }, { 78 }, { 2750 } } };[/code] Any help?

item.title: Need Help with array and for statement
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

So I found my problem in my herblore skill, I’m just trying to make all the interfaces work for everything, so you can make 10 of everything like runescape and stuff. But my error points here: for(int i : OTHER_SHIT){ if(!hasItems(i, currentItem)){ if(player.getUsername().equals("sageofmali")) player.sm("Messes up here !!. Current item: "+currentItem+" Other: "+i+" ID: "+id+" AMOUNT: "+amount+""); player.getHerblore().reset(); return; } }
What I’m trying to do is check if the inventory contains one of the items in the OTHER_SHIT array I have and has the currentItem as well. Here’s the array: public static int OTHER_SHIT[] = {221, 235, 225, 592, 1939, 223, 1581, 1975, 239, 231, 221, 235, 231, 2970, 10111, 225, 241, 223, 239, 245, 247};
And here’s the hasItem method: private boolean hasItems(int itemOne, int itemTwo) { return (player.getInventory().contains(itemOne) && player.getInventory().contains(itemTwo)); }
What I think is going on is that it’s going through every item in the array and if you don’t have all of the items in the array, it stops you from making the item. How could I fix this, because I use the OTHER_SHIT array for only this part and those items are in this: public static final int[][][] HERBLORE_INFO = new int[][][] { { { VIAL, 249, 0 }, { 91 }, { 1 }, { 321 } }, { { VIAL, 251, 1 }, { 93 }, { 5 }, { 504 } }, { { VIAL, 253, 2 }, { 95 }, { 12 }, { 612 } }, { { VIAL, 255, 3 }, { 97 }, { 22 }, { 785 } }, { { VIAL, 257, 4 }, { 99 }, { 30 }, { 990 } }, { { VIAL, 259, 5 }, { 101 }, { 45 }, { 1075 } }, { { VIAL, 261, 6 }, { 103 }, { 50 }, { 1875 } }, { { VIAL, 263, 7 }, { 105 }, { 55 }, { 2250 } }, { { VIAL, 3000, 8 }, { 3004 }, { 63 }, { 3900 } }, { { VIAL, 265, 9 }, { 107 }, { 66 }, { 4500 } }, { { VIAL, 267, 10 }, { 109 }, { 72 }, { 5000 } }, { { VIAL, 269, 11 }, { 111 }, { 78 }, { 7000 } }, { { 221, 91, 12 }, { 2428 }, { 1 }, { 250 } }, { { 235, 93, 13 }, { 2446 }, { 5 }, { 375 } }, { { 225, 95, 14 }, { 113 }, { 12 }, { 500 } }, { { 592, 95, 15 }, { 3408 }, { 15 }, { 500 } }, { { 1939, 91, 16 }, { 10142 }, { 19 }, { 300 } }, { { 223, 97, 17 }, { 2430 }, { 22 }, { 625 } }, { { 1581, 97, 18 }, { 1582 }, { 25 }, { 800 } }, { { 1975, 97, 19 }, { 3008 }, { 26 }, { 675 } }, { { 239, 99, 20 }, { 2432 }, { 30 }, { 750 } }, { { 231, 99, 21 }, { 2434 }, { 38 }, { 875 } }, { { 221, 101, 22 }, { 2436 }, { 45 }, { 2000 } }, { { 235, 101, 23 }, { 2448 }, { 48 }, { 2063 } }, { { 231, 103, 24 }, { 2438 }, { 50 }, { 2125 } }, { { 2970, 103, 25 }, { 3016 }, { 52 }, { 2175 } }, { { 10111, 103, 26 }, { 9998 }, { 53 }, { 2200 } }, { { 225, 105, 27 }, { 2440 }, { 55 }, { 2250 } }, { { 241, 105, 28 }, { 187 }, { 60 }, { 2375 } }, { { 223, 3004, 29 }, { 3024 }, { 63 }, { 2425 } }, { { 239, 107, 30 }, { 2442 }, { 66 }, { 2500 } }, { { 245, 109, 31 }, { 2444 }, { 72 }, { 2625 } }, { { 247, 111, 32 }, { 2450 }, { 78 }, { 2750 } } };
Any help?

Read full topic
